abstract: The twin themes resulted in collections bathed in incandescent white and highlighted by wimples, veils, cassocks and other mass-worthy raiment stripped down, and softened, for a modern eye.

lead_paragraph: FELLINI would have been spinning (cartwheels) in his grave had he witnessed the church-y proceedings on the runways of Paris this week. Taking in those shows, you might have suspected that some designers were reprising "Roma," the director's 1972 cinematic tour of the Eternal City complete with a fashion show including priests on roller skates, robotic bishops in miters and stoles, and nuns in habits made of blinking Christmas lights.
